So this is where it started

A leap year is a year of 366 days.
It's a leap year if:
the year is divisible by 4 and not divisible by 100 ;
the year is divisible by 400 ("divisible" means that the division gives a whole number, without remainder).
Otherwise, the year is not leap year: it has the usual length of 365 days.

These rules translate into the formula :

0.2425 = 1/4 - 1/100 + 1/400
which approximates quite precisely the decimals of the tropical year which is worth ~365.242 days, which is the time the earth takes to travel around the sun.

I love how Mythbusters is like "We will now use an object with much greater mass traveling at a much lower velocity to accurately portray an object with much lesser mass traveling at a much higher velocity and pretend that the results would be the same since the total energy of this object A is equivalent to object B". For instance, while trying to knock Buster out of his socks they resorted to a much heavier pendulum traveling at a lower velocity to simulate being struck by something traveling at a greater velocity. It would seem that Buster can only be accelerated to an average velocity compared to the object that strikes him. For instance if the object striking him  has a mass of 200 Kg while buster has a mass of 50Kg (warning, arbitrary numbers, I know that Buster does not have a Mass of 50 Kg nor did the object striking him have a mass of 200 Kg) then Buster would accelerate the pendulum in a negative relation equivalent to the force that the pendulum accelerates him positively. (In relation to their initial velocities) So if the pendulum was traveling at 25m/s before it strikes him then after the impact BOTH Buster and the pendulum would be traveling at 20m/s in the same direction. Therefore only 1/5 or 20% of the TOTAL energy of the pendulum would be transferred to buster.

This is assuming that there is no flexing involved which could absorb energy at impact and then rebound after the objects are moving at the same velocity to accelerate Buster to a GREATER velocity than the pendulum is traveling at after striking buster. This is actually an interesting phenomenon.

It is an very common misconception that one day is equal to one revolution of the earth on its axis. One day is the average time it takes for the sun to be on the same spot in the sky. One day is 24 hours, but the earth takes 23 hours 56 minutes and 4 seconds to rotate once. Since the earth has moved about one degree on its orbit around the sun during one day it takes 4 minutes for the sun to be on the same spot again.

Not completely true. It takes about 23 hours 56 minutes and 4 seconds for earth to rotate once on it axis. But since earth have moved about 1 degree on its orbit around the sun during that time it takes another 4 minutes for the sun to be on the same spot again. So If we were to say that one day equals one turn on earths axis the day/night cycle would shift by 4 minutes every day.
